channel.title: Droid Bionic vs HTC Thunderbolt?
channel.description:
Getting a new phone in a few hours, and I've narrowed it down to these two. Anyone have any experience with either? Neither has a CM port yet, so I'm stuck with Moroblur/HTC Sense for now. Thoughts?
I'd get the Galaxy S2, but I'm not going back to AT&T and their horrible customer service, and Sprint has no coverage where I'm going to be using the phone most of the time. So my mind is set on Verizon, and I've pretty much narrowed it down to these two phones, but I'm definitely open to other suggestions. Please no iPhone unless you can sell me on it 100% within an hour ;)

item.title: Droid Bionic vs HTC Thunderbolt?
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

Yea, I plug mine in over-night too. It lasts forever if I’m just doing basic phone things (calls and texting), but if I do anything like play games, listen to music on it, etc. it dies extremely quickly (3-4 hours).

Read full topic

item.title: Droid Bionic vs HTC Thunderbolt?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“m.dog311, post:8, topic:417088”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=519027.msg3773631#msg3773631 date=1317918820]
That’s why asking for suggestions doesn’t always work, it mostly comes down to preference. I couldn’t stand a phone without a full keyboard, I’m still using my original Droid.
[/quote]
Has yours gotten to the point where the battery life is so bad, that opening Dragon, Fly & playing it for more than 5 minutes drains the battery by about a quarter? :|[/quote]

It still lasts 12-16 hours per-day, which is fine. (I plug it in over-night)

Read full topic

item.title: Droid Bionic vs HTC Thunderbolt?
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

SlashGear – 7 Oct 11

Samsung postpones Google Galaxy Nexus debut

Samsung and Google have yanked their CTIA Fall product launch, the event expected to debut the Samsung Galaxy Prime aka Nexus Prime. “Samsung and Google decide to postpone the new product ann…

Glad I didn’t wait…

item.title: Droid Bionic vs HTC Thunderbolt?
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

Moparisthebest:

That’s why asking for suggestions doesn’t always work, it mostly comes down to preference. I couldn’t stand a phone without a full keyboard, I’m still using my original Droid.

Has yours gotten to the point where the battery life is so bad, that opening Dragon, Fly & playing it for more than 5 minutes drains the battery by about a quarter?

item.title: Droid Bionic vs HTC Thunderbolt?
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

[quote=“John459, post:6, topic:417088”]Please wait for this

SlashGear – 5 Oct 11

Samsung Nexus Prime pictured clear as day

It’s less than a week now from the final reveal of whatever Samsung has in store for us near the Autumn edition of CTIA, and would you look at that, someone’s posted a photo of the next…

[/quote]

Not only do I find the curve on it retarded, but I have a feeling the screen is going to be too big. 4.3" fits perfectly in my hand, and the Prime is a good 1/4" large than that. I don’t care about the faster processor speed, because in 2 months that will be outdated anyways.

I have 14 days to take back the phone if I don’t like it, and I will definitely play around with it, but if I could barely tell a difference between the thunderbolt and bionic, I doubt I’ll feel anything different with the prime.

Read full topic

item.title: Droid Bionic vs HTC Thunderbolt?
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

Moparisthebest:

That’s why asking for suggestions doesn’t always work, it mostly comes down to preference. I couldn’t stand a phone without a full keyboard, I’m still using my original Droid.

Eh, It was worth a try. My old phone was the Samsung Eternity. If I could get used to that horrible excuse for a touchscreen I think I could use just about any of them now
